triples.name: Multi-agent reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper extends multi-agent reinforcement learning by introducing a teaching mechanism for improved coordination.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: Knowledge transfer between agents is a core mechanism that enables teaching and learning improvement.

triples.name: Communication protocol
triples.relevance: Communication between agents is essential for implementing peer-to-peer teaching in the system.

triples.name: Cooperative game theory
triples.relevance: Cooperative game theory provides theoretical foundation for understanding cooperation among multiple agents with shared goals.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems form the computational framework within which cooperative learning and teaching occurs.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning principles underlie the learning algorithms used by agents to improve performance.

triples.name: Coordination game
triples.relevance: The paper proposes LeCTR as a novel solution to coordination games in multiagent systems through peer-to-peer teaching.
